awd_titl_txt: Building Collaborations: A Workshop Facilitating US-India Bilateral Research Collaborations
awd_abstract_narration:
The objective of the Building Collaborations workshop is to facilitate and catalyze research collaborations between U.S. and Indian Principal Investigators in leading-edge areas that are priority for both countries. Building Collaborations will provide a virtual, interactive platform for research engagement leading to the development of joint U.S India proposals. 

The workshop will lead to new bilateral collaborations in Artificial Intelligence (AI), Cyber-Physical Systems, Robotics and related areas, helping to accelerate research and innovation, advance the frontiers of science, and strengthen the Science and Technology engagement between the world’s two largest democracies.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

por.por_cntn:
The U.S. National Science Foundation (NSF) and the Department of Science and Technology (DST), Government of India have been working together to identify opportunities for R&D collaboration in areas of priority for both countries leveraging existing investments and infrastructure.  Both sides announced a new funding opportunity to support joint U.S.-India research projects in several priority areas.  The new program is a partnership between the National Science Foundation?s (NSF) Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering (CISE), Directorate for Engineering (ENG), and Office of International Science and Engineering (OISE) and six of the Technology Innovation Hubs funded by the Department of Science and Technology. 

To facilitate and catalyze research collaborations between U. S. PIs with active NSF awards and their Indian counterparts from the six Technology Innovation Hubs, the Building Collaborations workshop was held on March 15 and March 22, 2022.  The meeting format featured a series of breakout sessions organized by research themes providing opportunities for U.S. and Indian PIs to engage in substantive discussions.

Each of the six Indian Technology Innovation Hubs identified 4-6 PIs looking to start research collaborations.  U.S. PIs with active awards from 9 NSF Programs were encouraged to submit applications to be part of the Workshop.  Registration was accepted on a first-come, first-serve basis for the first 50 applicants.  The NSF workshop team reviewed the 90 unique applications and determined that 53 individuals were eligible and should be invited to the workshop.   The number of Indian participants was 52 (including members of the TIH leadership). Of these, 50 PIs attended both day 1 and day; 23 PIs attended only day 1; and 26 PIs attended only day 2.

The familiarity of participants was mixed. 69% (11/16) of U.S. participants indicated they were "Not Familiar" with the Indian Technology Innovation Hubs and their research themes prior to the workshop, while 31% indicated they were "Somewhat Familiar". 88% (14/16) of U.S. participants indicated this was a new collaboration (i.e. they met their potential Indian collaborator for the first time at the workshop), and 86% (12/14) of these individuals indicated they plan to submit a proposal in response to the joint U.S. India funding opportunity. 100% of Indian participants indicated this was a new collaboration (i.e. they met their potential U.S. collaborator for the first time at the workshop), and 69% (11/16) of these individuals indicated they plan to submit a proposal in response to the joint U.S. India funding opportunity.

The outcome of this workshop and NSF DCL led to funding 35 NSF awards with corresponding funding of projects in India. This announcement from Whitehouse talked about it (before all the awards were made) - https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/statements-releases/2022/05/24/readout-of-president-bidens-meeting-with-prime-minister-modi-of-india/

 

 


Last Modified: 05/08/2023
Modified by: Vipin Chaudhary
